prompt: There are statistical studies and partial explanations of the cause of schizophrenia, but no complete theory. Children born of older fathers are at higher risk. No schizophrenia-causing gene has been identified, but a few victims display a gene-mutation associated with Rett syndrome. Heavy daily use of marijuana starting before age 15 causes increased risk, but the risk decreases with age. Australian researchers found thinning of the outer layer of grey matter in the brain of victims. Other studies suggest environmental and social factors or natural chemical changes in a person's genome. ->
completion: The cause of schizophrenia is not completely understood # There are partial explanations for the cause of schizophrenia # There are statistical studies of the cause of schizophrenia # No schizophrenia-causing gene has been identified # Some schizophrenia victims have a gene-mutation associated with Rett syndrome # Environmental factors may contribute to schizophrenia # Social factors may contribute to schizophrenia  # Cannabis use before age 15 increases risk of schizophrenia  # The risk of cannabis triggering schizophrenia decreases with age END

prompt: On March 2, 2005 the Supreme Court faced the issue of whether display of the Ten Commandments (T.C.) at government buildings violates the principle of separation of church and state. Two cases from Texas and Kentucky raised several questions. Are the T.C. a religious statement, a part of legal history, or both? If courts and legislatures can call for God's help in invocations, what's wrong with displaying the T.C.? Does the appearance of the T.C. among other statuary constitute an endorsement? From justices' questions and remarks a split decision seemed likely. ->
completion: Split decision seemed likely # Are the T.C part of history? # Are the T.C. a religious statement? # Are the T.C. both a religious statement and a part of legal history? # Courts and legislatures can call for God's help in invocations # Does the appearance of the T.C. among other statuary constitute an endorsement? # If courts and legislatures can call for God's help in invocations, what's wrong with displaying the T.C.? # Two cases raised several questions END

prompt: The ivory-billed woodpecker, thought for 60 years to be extinct, has been discovered in a remote Arkansas swamp. Its existence has been confirmed by at least 8 sightings, a 4-second video, and its distinctive "double-knock" drumming. The first sighting was in February 2004 but was kept secret for over a year while experts confirmed the discovery and protected the bird's territory. Private groups and individuals have raised $10 million for protection of the woodpecker and its environment, while the federal government has proposed $10 million in federal funds. Massive logging had destroyed the woodpecker's habitat. ->
completion: The federal government committed over $10 million to protect the bird. # The ivory-billed woodpecker was last seen about 60 years ago. # Its existence has been confirmed by its distinctive "double-knock" drumming. END
